text.name: console_notes
text.text: CPS-2 or Capcom Play System 2 is an arcade card created by Capcom. It debuted in 1993 with the game Super Street Fighter II. CPS-2 consisted of two separate parts; a board A, which connects to JAMMA wiring and contains common components between the CPS-2 games, and a board B, which contains the game itself. The relationship between cards A and B is similar to that between a video game console and a cartridge. CPS-2 plates A and B are color-differentiated according to their region, and each plate only works when used with its counterpart of the same color.
